channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Poland Steels for Battle, Seeing Echoes of Cold War in Ukraine Crisis
item.description: Paramilitary groups in Poland have experienced sharp spikes in membership since Russia began meddling in Ukraine last year, and anxiety is apparent nationwide.
item.dc:creator: RICK LYMAN
item.media:credit: Piotr Malecki for The New York Times
item.media:description: Children played soccer as young members of the Shooters Association trained at a school in Kalisz.

item.title: World Briefing: Venezuela: Inmate Dies in State Custody
item.description: A man arrested last year during antigovernment demonstrations died in state custody, apparently in a suicide that his family said Friday was the result of harsh prison conditions and unjust punishment.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: U.S. Targets Shabab Unit in Somalia
item.description: It is unknown if a senior member of the Shabab militant group, believed to have helped plan the 2013 attack on the Westgate mall in Kenya, was killed.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT

item.title: Myanmar Warplane Kills Four Farmers in China
item.description: One or more bombs released from a warplane from Myanmar Friday struck a sugar cane field, as fighting between government forces and an ethnic group pressed against the frontier with China.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Cuba: U.S. Diplomat to Return for Third Round of Talks
item.description: The United States and Cuba will hold a third round of talks next week about restoring diplomatic ties and reopening embassies.
item.dc:creator: RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD

item.title: World Briefing: Maldives: Ex-President Is Sentenced to 13 Years in Prison
item.description: A former president of the Maldives, Mohamed Nasheed, was convicted and sentenced to 13 years in prison on Friday after a quick and disputed trial over accusations that he ordered a senior judge arrested while in office.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Iceland: No Longer Eager to Join E.U.
item.description: Iceland has withdrawn its bid to join the European Union, with the government saying its interests are best served outside the 28-nation bloc, a spokeswoman for the European Union said Friday.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: The Saturday Profile: A Holocaust Survivor Tells of Auschwitz at 18 and, Again, at 90
item.description: Eva Fahidi, who was sent to Auschwitz as a teenager, has been determined to share her memory of that place and to encourage scrutiny of the past.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE
item.media:credit: Akos Stiller for The New York Times
item.media:description: Eva Fahidi, a 90-year-old Holocaust survivor, at her home in Budapest.

item.title: U.S. Clinician With Ebola Under Care in Maryland
item.description: An American aid worker was infected while working in Sierra Leone, and he may have exposed colleagues in West Africa to the virus.
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
item.dc:creator: SHERI FINK

item.title: Unicef Clarifies Official’s Remarks That Appeared to Call for Talks With Militants
item.description: Unicef’s Syria representative touched off a minor tempest by appearing to propose that governments try to talk with the Islamic State about allowing aid workers to reach children.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Emissions by Makers of Energy Level Off
item.description: Carbon dioxide emissions from the world’s energy producers stalled in 2014, the first time in 40 years of measurement that the level did not increase during a period of economic expansion, the International Energy Agency says.
item.dc:creator: JOHN SCHWARTZ

item.title: Satirists, Led by Muslims, Find Much to Mock in ISIS
item.description: An expanding array of parody videos and songs, many by Muslim comedians, mock the Islamic State for its hypocrisies and excesses.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ASSIA LABBAS
item.media:description: A screen grab from YouTube of a “Saturday Night Live” video. The actress Dakota Johnson plays a daughter who drives off with a group of militants after telling her father: "Dad, it’s just ISIS."

item.title: France Charges 2 Suspected of Ties to Gunman in Attacks
item.description: The two men, charged with “terrorist conspiracy to commit crimes against people,” are suspected of links to Amedy Coulibaly, who attacked a kosher grocery in Paris.
item.dc:creator: MAÏA de la BAUME

item.title: Putin Has Vanished, but Rumors Are Popping Up Everywhere
item.description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia has not been seen in public since last week, and the rumor mill has gone into overdrive, churning out possible explanations from the simple to the salacious to the sinister.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:credit: Pool photo by Mikhail Klimentyev/Ria Novosti
item.media:description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, right, last week at a news conference in Moscow with Matteo Renzi, the Italian prime minister. It was the last confirmed public sighting of Mr. Putin.

item.title: British Leader Diverges From U.S. on China Policy and Military Spending
item.description: Prime Minister David Cameron has announced, over Washington’s objections, that his nation will back Beijing’s new development bank.
item.dc:creator: STEVEN ERLANGER and JANE PERLEZ
item.media:description: Prime Minister David Cameron, center, on Friday outside St. Paul’s Cathedral in London, with Camilla, the Duchess of Cornwall, and Defense Secretary Michael Fallon, at a parade after a service honoring those who fought and died in the Afghanistan war.

item.title: Pope Francis Predicts His Papacy Will Be Brief
item.description: Francis, marking the second anniversary of his papacy, gave an interview in which he left open the possibility that he might someday step down.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
item.media:description: Pope Francis hearing a confession at St. Peter’s Basilica on Friday, the second anniversary of the start of his papacy. In an interview, he left open the possibility that he might someday step down.

item.title: Open Source: Video of Female Arab Anchor Shutting Down Rude Male Guest Amazes Western Viewers
item.description: A Lebanese television host achieved viral fame after she cut off a long-winded Islamist guest, in part because of inaccurate reports of what was said.
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Islamist Websites in Turkey Manage to Evade Strict Internet Censorship
item.description: A hallmark of Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s leadership has been a crackdown on freedom of expression, but critics say censorship reflects the government’s Islamist values.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: TIM ARANGO
item.media:credit: Kayhan Ozer/Presidential Palace Press Office, via Reuters
item.media:description: President Tayyip Erdogan led a meeting on Monday with cabinet ministers at the Presidential Palace in Ankara.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: At Chinese Political Meetings, the Fashion Is Restraint
item.description: Once a stage for some of China’s most powerful politicians and high achievers to strut the trappings of their success, the sessions have been characterized by conspicuous nonconsumption this year.
item.dc:creator: JESS MACY YU
item.media:description: Li Xiaolin, chief executive of China Power International Development and daughter of former Premier Li Peng, who in the past attracted comment for her designer clothes, adopted a lower-key look for this year's meetings of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

item.title: World Briefing: International Criminal Court Formally Ends Case Against Kenya’s President
item.description: The proceedings against President Uhuru Kenyatta were closed three months after prosecutors dropped charges linking him to postelection violence in 2007.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: MARLISE SIMONS
